channel.title: Comments on: Government Spends More on Corporate Welfare Subsidies than Social Welfare Programs

item.title: By: Navaid Syed
item.dc:creator: Navaid Syed
item.description: My point is that Capitalism drives innovation, not the crony government regulations.
item.content:encoded: My point is that Capitalism drives innovation, not the crony government regulations.

item.title: By: Barry Straight
item.dc:creator: Barry Straight
item.description: corporations pay taxes, welfare is payed with those corporate taxes. so corporate welfare is really just them paying less taxes, while welfare generates no income.and is payed for by corporations and the rest of us tax payers
item.content:encoded: corporations pay taxes, welfare is payed with those corporate taxes. so corporate welfare is really just them paying less taxes, while welfare generates no income.and is payed for by corporations and the rest of us tax payers

item.title: By: Cindy
item.dc:creator: Cindy
item.description: I have one. I've sent a letter to Dems, Republicans and even Obama when he was in office and the ONLY PERSON to answer me back was Bernie Sanders. I asked why are the taxpayers pay for "temporary employees?" Hiring a temporary employee is a "tax write off and expense." Frankly, I don't understand why the taxpayers are paying for free labor to successful companies!!!!! It STINKS OF CORRUPTION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
item.content:encoded: I have one. I’ve sent a letter to Dems, Republicans and even Obama when he was in office and the ONLY PERSON to answer me back was Bernie Sanders. I asked why are the taxpayers pay for “temporary employees?” Hiring a temporary employee is a “tax write off and expense.” Frankly, I don’t understand why the taxpayers are paying for free labor to successful companies!!!!! It STINKS OF CORRUPTION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

item.title: By: Andrew Bennett
item.dc:creator: Andrew Bennett
item.description: I read you loud and clear! AMAN! The federal and States Governments allow Corporate welfare Frauds by Corporation, Companies, Factories, big oil and gas and Coal Mines, and Tobacco and Auto industry and Military Contractors !
item.content:encoded: I read you loud and clear! AMAN! The federal and States Governments allow Corporate welfare Frauds by Corporation, Companies, Factories, big oil and gas and Coal Mines, and Tobacco and Auto industry and Military Contractors !

item.title: By: Andrew Bennett
item.dc:creator: Andrew Bennett
item.description: In one year the USA Federal and State Government spent $11.9 Trillion dollars that equal to a 175 years of surplus funds, to save; Corporate banks, State Banks, Federal Banks, The Auto Industry, and The Wall Street Stock and New York stock Exchange all so that they could give BONUS to the top 1%. The 99% aka Middle-Class workers was laid-off to pay for the bonuses and whom didn't receive any bonus for a job well done! A $15.99-$20.00 Minimum wage would take Thousand of people off of welfare and government assistance. On the job training would help as well.
item.content:encoded: In one year the USA Federal and State Government spent $11.9 Trillion dollars that equal to a 175 years of surplus funds, to save; Corporate banks, State Banks, Federal Banks, The Auto Industry, and The Wall Street Stock and New York stock Exchange all so that they could give BONUS to the top 1%. The 99% aka Middle-Class workers was laid-off to pay for the bonuses and whom didn’t receive any bonus for a job well done! A $15.99-$20.00 Minimum wage would take Thousand of people off of welfare and government assistance. On the job training would help as well.

item.title: By: Sparafucile
item.dc:creator: Sparafucile
item.description: Know what you need before you can "buy up" anything? A willing seller. That is called labor. Get over it.
item.content:encoded: Know what you need before you can “buy up” anything? A willing seller. That is called labor. Get over it.

item.title: By: Sparafucile
item.dc:creator: Sparafucile
item.description: Ok ... you can do arithmatic. But you clearly cannot do accounting. Go learn what profit is, before you start trying to claim it by the trillions for your own wishes.
item.content:encoded: Ok … you can do arithmatic. But you clearly cannot do accounting. Go learn what profit is, before you start trying to claim it by the trillions for your own wishes.

item.title: By: Rachel Rhodes
item.dc:creator: Rachel Rhodes
item.description: hey, thanks for communication! gettin out my pencil, but I get your point!
item.content:encoded: hey, thanks for communication! gettin out my pencil, but I get your point!

item.title: By: Mike P. Sinn
item.dc:creator: Mike P. Sinn
item.description: Thanks, Rachael! Actually, 50% more doesn't mean 50% of $92 in this context. 50% more means 50% of $59 billion + $59 billion. ($92 - $59)/$59 = 55% more spent on corporate welfare. I just rounded to 50%. :D
item.content:encoded: Thanks, Rachael! Actually, 50% more doesn’t mean 50% of $92 in this context. 50% more means 50% of $59 billion + $59 billion. ($92 – $59)/$59 = 55% more spent on corporate welfare. I just rounded to 50%. ðŸ˜€

item.title: By: Rachel Rhodes
item.dc:creator: Rachel Rhodes
item.description: you undermine your (excellent) point by the numbers- sorry but 59 is not 50% of 92
item.content:encoded: you undermine your (excellent) point by the numbers- sorry but 59 is not 50% of 92
